timeline.bodyText: This doesn't seem very intuitive. Because a comparator is set, it becomes a priority queue.
timeline.author: pveentjer

replies.bodyText: It's how we avoid yet another config class and another interface and another method on HazelcastInstance. I don't mind, as long as the documentation is clear. Any other suggestions for exposing a priority queue?
replies.author: mmedenjak

replies.bodyText: I do mind because it isn't intuitive. I think having an explicit property on it like 'boolean priorityQueue' makes more sense en have a default comparator implementation be in place that makes use of the Comparable interface. So the only thin someone should need to do is 'queueConfig.setPriorityQueue(true)....' This way it is explicit.
replies.author: pveentjer

replies.bodyText:
@pveentjer
I agree that API should be intuitive for usage. What's your take on below suggestions?
<!-- Current implementation -->
<queue name="myQueue">
        <comparator-class-name>com.mycompany.MyQueueItemSpecificComparator</comparator-class-name>
        <duplicate-allowed>false</duplicate-allowed>
</queue>

<!-- Alternative 1  priority-queue element with a cardinality min = 0 and max = 1 -->
<queue name="myQueue">
		<priority-queue>
			<comparator-class-name>com.mycompany.MyQueueItemSpecificComparator</comparator-class-name>
			<duplicate-allowed>false</duplicate-allowed>
		</priority-queue>
</queue>

<!-- Alternative 2: This is my favorite: when one of comparator-class-name or duplicate-allowed is not null, then kind is always a priority-queue -->
<queue name="myQueue" kind="priority-queue" comparator-class-name="com.mycompany.MyQueueItemSpecificComparator" duplicate-allowed=false>
</queue>
replies.author: wangumer

replies.bodyText:
Following suggestions done above, I finally went for this to configure a priority based queue
<queue name="myQueue" queue-type="PRIORITY_QUEUE" comparator-class-name="com.mycompany.MyQueueItemSpecificComparator" duplicate-allowed=false></queue>
replies.author: wangumer

timeline.bodyText: This seems to be very use case specific. I'm not sure we want to have this in the codebase.
timeline.author: pveentjer

replies.bodyText:
Hi Peter,
Thanks for your kind feedback so far.
You are right. This is really use case specific. I would have like to provide a solution without altering internal of Queue implementation.
I am open for alternative solution.
replies.author: wangumer

replies.bodyText: I don't think there is an alternative solution. But there is no queue implementation that has duplicate detection and I have never had the need for it. So I don't see a good reason why it should be in here; this is a general-purpose data-structure and we should prevent add use case-specific additions. It makes the code complex to maintain and use.
replies.author: pveentjer

replies.bodyText: What happens when a regular queue is created and duplicate allowed is set to false? Afaik there is no duplicate checking in the regular queue (would be undesirable due to complexity). So is there an exception if you set the duplicates allowed to false, but don't create a priority queue? Or is the setting ignored?
replies.author: pveentjer

replies.bodyText: Attribute duplicate-allowed in the config holds only for priority queue. This setting is completely ignored for regular queue.
replies.author: wangumer

replies.bodyText:
I don't think there is an alternative solution. But there is no queue implementation that has duplicate detection and I have never had the need for it. So I don't see a good reason why it should be in here; this is a general-purpose data-structure and we should prevent add use case-specific additions. It makes the code complex to maintain and use.

I can understand your concerns about providing use case specific additions on general data structure. In the current case the addition is transparent for API user and the default works for standard data structure as in previous release.
Yes, real usecase can be rare to find. In our case we are currently using this in production with HC V.3.12 (we have our own queue implementation) and we would want to keep the functionality. I am not sure it is something we would want to handle at the application level without trying to build the same distribution already supported in HC.
You are right about the complexity that this could add to the codebase. For this enhancement, it just turns out that it was rather limited in my opinion.
replies.author: wangumer

timeline.bodyText: What is the advantage of using a getter here?
timeline.author: pveentjer

replies.bodyText: Nope. Will revert back.
replies.author: wangumer

timeline.bodyText: The NoDuplicatePriorityQueue is stored in a single partition and as a consequence will not be accessed concurrently. There should not be any need to synchronize.
timeline.author: pveentjer

replies.bodyText: Ok
replies.author: wangumer

timeline.bodyText: This add a constant memory overhead per item stored. I can't say I'm too excited about that.
timeline.author: pveentjer

replies.bodyText:
Right. This is a comparable implementation of something we are using in production with HC 3.12 where IQueue SPI allowed creation of specialized queue.
Any suggestion on how to improve this?
replies.author: wangumer

timeline.bodyText:
The complexity to add an item to the priority is O(Log(N)) because the priority queue is based on a binary heap.
But now the value that is added, is deserialized very every value it needs to be compared with.
So with N items, the total number of deserializations is 2Log(N)). If there are many items in the priority queue or when the items take a long time to deserialize, this can be a serious performance problem. So I would at least optimize is so that Log(N)+1 deserialization are needed instead of 2Log(N))
timeline.author: pveentjer

replies.bodyText: You could cache the value in the comparator but be very careful with caching a value indefinably. I'm not sure if a new comparator is created or an existing one is recycled.
replies.author: pveentjer

replies.bodyText: Added deserialized value caching in QueueItem, it will only be used in case of priority queue.
replies.author: mmedenjak

timeline.bodyText: I don't see any change in the 'constructors' array
timeline.author: pveentjer

replies.bodyText: I don't believe we need an explicit serializer for this logic. It can just piggyback on whatever kind of serialization is in place. So let it implement the appropriate serialization interface.
replies.author: pveentjer

replies.bodyText: Ups! This just a tryout which slips into commit. Will revert it.
replies.author: wangumer

timeline.bodyText: This is not going to work. The issue is that the same data might be serialized differently from time to time; so the same instance is not guaranteed to give the same Data.
timeline.author: pveentjer

replies.bodyText: Can you elaborate how the same instance serializes as different Data instances?
replies.author: mmedenjak

timeline.message:
Cleanup

- fix imports
- reformat config class and add nullability annotations
- remove unused class
- add rolling upgrade checks
- add missing config infrastructure and test code
- minor typos
- regenerate client codecs

timeline.bodyText: I would consider caching config.isPriorityQueue() in a final field. If the config changes - that is shouldn't, but still - for any reason, we get a funky behavior.
timeline.author: blazember

replies.bodyText: Cached. I see we have other calls to config in various methods but I'll keep that for another PR.
replies.author: mmedenjak

timeline.author: blazember

timeline.bodyText: I'd consider adding a check here that warns if queueStoreConfig#memoryLimit is set together with comparatorClassName. I'd even consider treating this situation an invalid configuration since we ignore memoryLimit in the implementation, which is against the user's intention.
timeline.author: blazember

replies.bodyText:
As agreed, added warning on queue container startup because of two reasons:

there is a limit set by default and the only way to disable it is to set it to Integer.MAX_VALUE
I prefer not to do validation while the config is still being created, maybe the user is in the process of making it valid.
replies.author: mmedenjak

timeline.bodyText: I would add that setting this to non-null also makes the store's memory limit setting ignored.
timeline.author: blazember

replies.bodyText: Fixed.
replies.author: mmedenjak

timeline.author: blazember

replies.bodyText: Fixed.
replies.author: mmedenjak

replies.bodyText: Also changed the Semaphores with negative initial values to CountDownLatch.
replies.author: mmedenjak

timeline.bodyText: Shall we shutdown the executor in the end of the test to avoid leak?
timeline.author: petrpleshachkov

replies.bodyText: Nice catch! Added creation and destruction in Before and After blocks.
replies.author: mmedenjak

timeline.message:
Proof of concept for priority queue support

Defined comparator class name in QueueConfig which can be queried to set user defined comparator for PriorityQueue in QueueContainer

Define a comparator attribute in config xsd queue element

Process and supply value to QueueConfig for server XML configuration

Define a comparator holder which deserializes queueItem data before comparison

Configuration attribute to for queue without duplicates

Implementation of a priority queue which get rid of duplicates
Provide additional javadocs

Provide configuration for new priority queue

Improve javadocs and provide additional tests

Add configuration for PriorityQueue in QueueConfig

Follow steps defined in https://github.com/hazelcast/hazelcast/wiki/Checklist-for-Hazelcast-config-changes

Take into account new concerns on queue migration,

queue backup within a cluster,
transaction rollback on timeout.
All those changes are related to itemQueue datastructure change
in QueueContainer from LinkedList to PriorityQueue

Use Queue interface in QueueContainer

Provide Priority Queue specialization alongside the LinkedList to support both queue types depending on queue configuration
Forbid a cluster version less than 4.1 to be used with priority queue
Apply pull request suggestions and fix unittest failures
Cache deserialized data to improve PriorityQueue item comparison performance
Priority queue configuration now defined as attributes of queue element
revert no duplicate queue support

Cleanup

- fix imports
- reformat config class and add nullability annotations
- remove unused class
- add rolling upgrade checks
- add missing config infrastructure and test code
- minor typos
- regenerate client codecs
Fix tests

Further cleanup

- remove guava
- remove unnecessary import reordering
- align code with master to avoid unnecessary code changes
- cleanup generics
- remove unnecessary instance creation
Fix tests
Attempt at caching deserialized values for queue items
test cases added for priority queue behavior, incl. duplicate check test case
Fix checkstyle
Cleanup tests and add migration test

Add more tests for priority queue, fix minor issues

- parametrize existing queue tests
- fix issues found during testing
- add javadoc to config class and move properties which are meant for configuration
- minor cleanups
Fix checkstyle
Fix compilation issue after rebase and regenerate protocol
Address review comments
Address review comments
Checkstyle
Regenerate client protocol
Regenerate client protocol
